alert.note: Alert for Coastal Liberty; Coastal McIntosh; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LIBERTY AND MCINTOSH COUNTIES... At 525 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from South Newport to near Cox, and moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Darien, Jones, Wolf Island, Eulonia, Valona, Little Saint Simons Island, South Newport, and Cox. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 15 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
